table.name: Common Languages
rows: Humans, dwarves, elves, halflings, and other common ancestries

table.name: Monk Unarmed Attacks
intro: Some monk stances allow you to make special unarmed attacks while in those stances. These attacks are summarized here.
footnotes: * {@spell Wild winds stance} is a ki spell, so you can find out more about wind crash on page 402.

table.name: Skills, Key Abilities, and Actions
footnotes: {@sup D} This skill action can be used only during downtime.
{@sup E} This skill action is used during exploration.

{@sup G} This is a general skill action, with a description appearing on pages 234–240 instead of under the entries for the various skills it’s used for. Decipher Writing appears on page 234, Earn Income on page 236, Identify Magic and Learn a Spell on page 238, and Subsist on page 240.

table.name: Climb and Swim Distance
intro: This table provides a quick reference for how far you can move with a {@action Climb} or {@action Swim} action.

table.name: General Feats
rows: Gain access to ancestry feats from another ancestry
Become trained in a type of armor
Hold your breath longer and gain benefits against inhaled threats
Become an expert in a saving throw or {@skill Perception}
Die at {@condition dying} 5, rather than dying 4
Regain more HP from rest, recover faster from disease and poisons
Automatically succeed at commanding your mount to move
Ward off a blow with your shield
Increase your maximum HP and reduce the DCs of recovery checks
Become trained in a weapon type
Become more adept at using untrained skills
Search areas in half the time

table.name: Bulk of Creatures
intro: You might need to know the Bulk of a creature, especially if you need to carry someone off the battlefield. The table that follows lists the typical Bulk of a creature based on its size, but the GM might adjust this number.

table.name: Changing Equipment
rows: Draw or put away a worn item, or pick up an item{@sup 1}
Pass an item to or take an item from a willing creature{@sup 2}
Drop an item to the ground
Detach a shield or item strapped to you
Change your grip by removing a hand from an item
Change your grip by adding a hand to an item
Retrieve an item from a backpack{@sup 3}, sack, or similar container
footnotes: {@sup 1} If you retrieve a two-handed item with only one hand, you still need to change your grip before you can wield or use it.
{@sup 2} A creature must have a hand free for someone to pass an item to them, and they might then need to change their grip if they receive an item requiring two hands to wield or use.
{@sup 3} Retrieving an item stowed in your own backpack requires first taking off the backpack with a separate {@action Interact} action.

table.name: Damaging Armor
rows: Metal ({@item breastplate}, {@item chain mail}, {@item chain shirt}, {@item full plate}, {@item half plate}, {@item scale mail}, {@item splint mail})
intro: Your armor's statistics are based on the material it's predominantly made from. It's not likely your armor will take damage, as explained in Item Damage on page 272.

table.name: Shields
footnotes: {@sup 1} Gaining a shield's circumstance bonus to AC requires using the {@action Raise a Shield} action (found on page 472).
{@sup 2} Getting the higher bonus for a tower shield requires using the {@action Take Cover} action (page 471) while the shield is raised.
